cultural_context.conversation_reference: Initial context memory system setup discussion
cultural_context.note: Initial population - needs significant expansion with cultural domain expertise

foundational_principle.content: Cultural considerations are paramount in all technical decisions affecting data access and visibility
foundational_principle.core_principle: Respect for Native American cultural heritage and community control over cultural materials
foundational_principle.architectural_influence: Cultural sensitivity requirements drive major technical architecture decisions

access_level_system.content: Access levels are the primary technical mechanism for respecting cultural sensitivities and community control
access_level_system.implementation: Multi-level access system where different materials have different visibility restrictions
access_level_system.cultural_rationale: Ensures culturally sensitive materials are only accessible to appropriate audiences
access_level_system.technical_integration: Access levels must be respected throughout all system components - database, API, file access

public_server_restrictions.content: Public server contains only access level 1 materials as primary cultural protection mechanism
public_server_restrictions.protection_approach: Subset of files and sanitized metadata on public server ensures culturally sensitive materials remain on private server only
public_server_restrictions.access_level_1_definition: Materials appropriate for general public access without cultural restrictions
public_server_restrictions.sync_filtering: Private server publishing process must filter by access level before pushing to public server

dual_server_cultural_rationale.content: Dual-deployment architecture exists primarily to enable cultural sensitivity controls through data segregation
dual_server_cultural_rationale.cultural_driver: Need to provide public access while maintaining strict control over culturally sensitive materials
dual_server_cultural_rationale.technical_solution: Complete separation of public-appropriate vs restricted materials across different server infrastructures

field_level_filtering.content: Database synchronization includes field-level filtering to exclude sensitive information from public server
field_level_filtering.filtering_approach: Serializers control which fields are included in public API and cross-server sync
field_level_filtering.sensitive_field_examples: Internal notes, restricted collaborator information, detailed cultural context

ceremonial_content.content: Ceremonial music and content requires special cultural sensitivity and access considerations

linguistic_materials.content: System handles linguistic heritage materials with language and dialect information

access_levels.content: Multi-level access system (1-4) suggests graduated access based on cultural sensitivity
access_levels.cultural_rationale: Different materials require different levels of protection and community control

cultural_domain_knowledge.note: Detailed cultural context and domain expertise to be populated during audit phase
